titleStmt.title: Amicus reipublicæ. = The Common-Wealths friend or an exact and speedie course to justice and right, and for preventing and determining of tedious law-suits. With many other things very considerable for the good of the publick. All which are fully controverted and debated in law. By John March of Grayes-Inne, barister.
titleStmt.author: March, John, 1612-1657.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Will. Bentley, for Francis Eglesfield, at the Marygold in S. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf is blank except for fleuron.
Running title reads: The Common-wealths friend.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Marygold in S. Pauls Church-yard
